content:
There are at least three ways:

1) In your message compose window, press the Alt key if the menu isn't shown, then use the menu option File | Attach | Files(s) and browse to the attachment file;

2) Hit Ctrl+Shift+A to bring up a file browse window;

3) Simply drag and drop the file onto the Compose/Write window.
creator: rednoise

content: I'm not sure I understand your intention, but multiple folders can be selected in the Folders List by holding down the <Ctrl> key while clicking on non-contiguous ones, or while holding <Shift> and selecting a range. You can then right-click on the selection and use the <Move To> pop-up menu to move them to the top level of your Local Folders. The selection can also be drag-and-dropped to the top level of Local Folders.
creator: rednoise

content:
Thunderbird's chat is based on libpurple. So I guess you will have to wait until a version of that is release with Omemo encryption support. Perhaps join the discussion in the ideas forum as your topic here is not a support request. https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/omemo-encryption-for-xmpp-messages/idi-p/31548

For future reference ideas and feedback are linked from the Thunderbird help menu. Right under this support forum.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Se il protocollo e IMAP (come riferito qui: https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1563919) è il server che fa la classificazione e non Thunderbird. Tant'è vero che tu stesso dicevi di segnalare lo spam anche in webmail senza risultati.

Su Thunderbird puoi però provare ad abilitare filtri ulteriori come spiegato nella sezione Utilizzare un servizio di filtri esterno di questo articolo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-posta-indesiderata-spam

p.s. cortesemente non aprire ogni volta una nuova discussione, puoi aggiungere le tue nuove risposte direttamente sotto.
creator: @next
